WHO: You know, no one knows me on this planet. I could give myself a whole different name if I wanted.

WHEN: I may be able to take off for home as soon as tomorrow. Just need to find the manual.

NOTE_NO: there are no more notes to find
I cleaned up all the torn pages
NOTE_TEXT: Day 71 Planetside: I lost the satellite feed today, right in the middle of Miranda throwing her wine in Julie's face. At least I still have the recordings. Miranda's basically my best friend after all the time we've spent together on this boring mission.

Day 1 Planetside: The new base has been established. Today marks the beginning of my astronautical adventure on Planet 30x-98. I will have to think of a better name for this world - I'll be here for quite a while after all.

Day 76 Planetside: Well. Figured out why I lost satellite feed. Turns out my homeplanet and everyone I know or care about died, probably incredibly painfully, in a literal nuclear holocaust. The emergency signal was sitting in my inbox for days while I did fuck all.

Day 24 Planetside: I've been analyzing the deerp's food sources. Interestingly, they seem to tolerate high glycoalkaloid levels far better than I'd expect. Time to conduct a practical experiment - can deerp eat sprouted potatoes? EDIT: yes. yes they can.
Day why the hell does it matter Planetside: If you're a social creature, but you lose all social connection, are you even still living? Why am I even writing this when no one will ever see it?
ANOTHER_NOTE: I thought I got rid of all these. I wonder if any others are still lying around.
It seems so long ago now.
